Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should ban the use of child actors", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: So few child actors go on to have a stable childhood and normal adulthood having lived in the artificial world of show business.<sep>Keypoint: Child performers tend to develop problems later in life
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that so few child actors go on to have a stable childhood and normal adulthood having lived in the artificial world of show business.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: There are many protections available for child actors to permit them to work and be safe<sep>Keypoint: Child performers should not be banned as long as there is supervision/regulation
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that there are many protections available for child actors to permit them to work and be safe

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Being able to portray children is an important part of today's media. there are already sufficient regulations in place to ensure the safety of the actors, and it gives children a financial head start.<sep>Keypoint: The parents should decide for their child
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that being able to portray children is an important part of today's media. there are already sufficient regulations in place to ensure the safety of the actors, and it gives children a financial head start.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Because many child actors end up pscyhologically damaged and neglected, ruining the rest of their lives<sep>Keypoint: Child performers tend to develop problems later in life
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that because many child actors end up pscyhologically damaged and neglected, ruining the rest of their lives

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Child actors are needed to portray children in movies and shows. we can't ban them.<sep>Keypoint: Child performers are necessary for roles
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that child actors are needed to portray children in movies and shows. we can't ban them.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: The use of child actors shall be banned because fame at a young age rarely results in a normal healthy life<sep>Keypoint: Being a performer harms the child's education
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that the use of child actors shall be banned because fame at a young age rarely results in a normal healthy life
